TopicTitle: Can someone tell me how to build a Refueling Station

Articles.Content: I tried docking a big Cryo/X Orange fuel tank with docking ports, then I tried refueling a ship but I didn't see any option where you can transfer fuel.

1 hour ago, Seth Kerman said:

I tried docking a big Cryo/X Orange fuel tank with docking ports, then I tried refueling a ship but I didn't see any option where you can transfer fuel.

You have to press and hold mod key ("Alt" if you're windows user),then right click on the first tank and then on the second or more.
After that you will get to transfer fuel "in"(will transfer fuel in from all chosen tanks) or "out"(will transfer fuel out to all chosen tanks).
If you play in "career mode" then you have to upgrade "R&D building" to tier 2 to enable fuel transfer.
Thnaks m8 i'll try it

2 hours ago, sebi.zzr said:

You have to press and hold mod key ("Alt" if you're windows user),then right click on the first tank and then on the second or more.

minor correction:  you don't actually have to hold the alt key for the first tank you select, you can just click on it as per normal (though holding alt doesn't hurt anything).  It's only with the second and subsequent parts that you need to hold alt while clicking.
You can even open a 3rd (probably more) tank for really weird fuel transfer options!

1 hour ago, klesh said:

You can even open a 3rd (probably more) tank for really weird fuel transfer options!

As many as you like.  It's not so much "weird" -- I use it all the time, for example when I've got one central tank and some symmetric radial tanks around it.  It's handy for filling up the radial tanks from the center one, or vice versa.  If you've got >2 selected, then when you click the "In" button on a tank, it will pull fuel from all of the others (and the reverse if you click the "out" button).

But some enlightenment never hurts

First you need a Tier 2 R&D building before you can do fuel transfers. Then, as said above, you have to open at least two context menus for fuel tanks (and only fuel tanks). The fuel transfer buttons will show up automatically.

An alternate method for opening multiple context menus is to open one, and then pin it. Once it is pinned, you can easily open a second one.

After you master doing it manually, there are a couple of mods that make the process easier to manage, especially when you're dealing with stations with many tanks.

Check out TAC Fuel Balancer or Ship Manifest. I settled on TAC because the UI was a bit easier for me to understand, but Ship Manifest has more capabilities
